content:
From: Makarius <makarius@sketis.net>
Dear Isabelle and macOS users,

how is the experience concerning macOS 10.13 High Sierra so far?

I have made a test installation of it and played with it a little.
Isabelle2017 seems to run mostly fine, but there are small dropouts in
the rendering of Isabelle SideKick. This is probably due to HTML GUI
rendering problems that Oracle and/or Apple still need to sort out (the
update from Java 8u144 to current Java 8u152 did not help).

Are there more serious problems encountered in practical work?

Makarius

From: Dmitriy Traytel <traytel@inf.ethz.ch>
Hi Makarius,

I'm using Isabelle2017 on High Sierra without serious problem.

A slight annoyance is that I don't see which Panel is currently selected with the Mac OS X look-and-feel. (See attached pictures comparing Mac OS X and Metal, w.r.t. the selected Documentation Panel docked at the right.) But I guess this is rather a more general problem of jEdit.

Dmitriy

From: Gerwin.Klein@data61.csiro.au
I have been using Isabelle2017 with High Sierra on the work desktop for about a week or so. No serious issues so far.

Cheers,
Gerwin

From: "Thiemann, Rene" <Rene.Thiemann@uibk.ac.at>
Dear Makarius,

I’m working on High Sierra for roughly 2 weeks on one of my machines and did not
find any Isabelle-related problems. (Though I have some sporadic freezes which
seem to occur in any application, independent on whether Isabelle was started or not).

Cheers,
René
